title: Lowriders, bikers and Bloods: life with America's outsiders – in pictures
text: Israel, Espanola, Chimayo, New Mexico, 2003 (from series Lowriders) ‘Usually, when you hop (jump) a lowrider, you do it with nobody in the car, as you don’t want the extra weight. For the photograph, I thought it would be really cool for the driver to be in the ride, so I stand back, and he’s in the car, starting to hop it. Keep in mind that I was shooting with a twin-lens medium format Mamiya, which is not the fastest camera out there, and after I got two or three frames, one of front wheels fell off, a result of the additional weight.’
description: Hunter Barnes documents people on the edges of US society. ‘I never go to a place with a camera first,’ says the photographer. ‘I spend a lot on beer and coffee instead’
